department_name: County of San Luis Obispo Health Agency Environmental Health Services Division

grading_system.description: As of May 5, 2025, uses a negative scoring scale starting from zero with points deducted for violations. Previously used 100-point system (max 100 points) with deductions for violations.

inspection_details.frequency: Annual health permit includes one routine inspection and one reinspection
inspection_details.reinspection_trigger: Follow up inspections conducted when health inspector determines during regular inspection that compliance verification is required
inspection_details.public_disclosure: Inspection reports are public record, must be maintained onsite and available upon request. Full results posted online via EatSafeSLO interactive map and MyHealthDepartment database

facility_safety_authority.department_name: CAL FIRE San Luis Obispo County Fire Department
facility_safety_authority.ansul_system_requirements: NFPA 96 standards require kitchen fire suppression system inspection by licensed fire protection contractor at least every six months
facility_safety_authority.inspection_frequency: Semi-annual inspections required for commercial kitchen fire suppression systems

regulatory_framework.food_code_basis: California Retail Food Code (California Health and Safety Code §113700-114437)
regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County-level enforcement by San Luis Obispo County Environmental Health Services Division, with state oversight from California Department of Public Health Food and Drug Branch
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: County follows California Retail Food Code requirements with local implementation
permit_types: Health Permit to Operate Food Facility

confidence_notes: Information verified from official county website and recent system updates documented. New negative scoring system implemented May 2025 is clearly documented.
verification_notes: All key information confirmed from official sources. Note that San Luis Obispo County recently transitioned to a new negative scoring system effective May 5, 2025, replacing their previous 100-point system.

warnings: ⚠️  [integrity] grading_system.score_range_min: Negative minimum score — verify this is correct (got: -100)
